title: Quiz 1: Fundamentals of NCDs
description: Test your understanding of NCD definitions, classifications, and global epidemiology.

questions.question: Which of the following best defines Non-Communicable Diseases (NCDs)?

options.text: Acute infections spread rapidly from person to person
Chronic conditions not resulting from acute infections and generally not transmissible
Short-term illnesses caused exclusively by bacteria
Diseases that only affect the elderly population

questions.explanation: NCDs are chronic conditions that do not result from acute infectious processes and are generally not transmissible from person to person.
questions.hint: Think about the duration (chronic vs acute) and transmissibility.

questions.question: Globally, NCDs are the leading cause of death, accounting for approximately ___BLANK___ percent of all deaths annually.
questions.explanation: NCDs are responsible for approximately 71% of all global deaths, translating to 41 million deaths annually.

questions.question: Match the NCD category with its description:

richContent.content:
Classification Review:
NCDs are grouped based on the system they affect or their underlying cause.

pairs.right: Disorders of the heart and blood vessels

questions.explanation: CVDs affect the heart; Respiratory diseases affect lungs; Nutritional diseases stem from deficiencies; Congenital problems are birth defects.
questions.hint: Match the disease examples to their broader categories.

questions.question: The majority of premature NCD deaths (between ages 30-69) occur in high-income countries.
questions.explanation: 85% of premature deaths occur in low- and middle-income countries, not high-income countries.
questions.hint: Consider where healthcare resources might be more limited.

questions.question: According to the study material, which of the following are major classifications of NCDs? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Diabetes, Mental illnesses, and Accidents are classified as NCDs. Malaria and Influenza are infectious (communicable) diseases.
questions.hint: Exclude diseases caused by pathogens like viruses or parasites.

questions.question: What is the term for birth defects such as congenital heart diseases and Down's syndrome listed under NCD classification?
questions.explanation: Congenital problems include birth defects like congenital heart diseases, spinal bifida, and Down's syndrome.
questions.hint: The word starts with 'C' and refers to conditions present from birth.

questions.question: Based on the epidemiology data below, what is the projected trend for NCDs in Africa by 2030?

richContent.content:
Africa Statistics (2008): 2.8 million deaths.
Global Premature Deaths: 15 million annually.
Trend Analysis: Rapidly increasing mortality rates.

options.text: They will become the leading cause of death
They will remain stable at 2008 levels

questions.explanation: In Africa, NCDs caused about 2.8 million deaths in 2008, with a rising trend projected to make NCDs the leading cause of death by 2030.

questions.question: More than ___BLANK___ percent of deaths in individuals over 45 years are attributable to NCDs.
questions.explanation: More than 62% of deaths in individuals over 45 years are attributable to NCDs.
questions.hint: It is slightly over sixty percent.

questions.question: Arrange the following NCDs based on the order they appear in the major classification list provided in the notes:
questions.explanation: The classification order in the text is: 1. Cardiovascular, 2. Cancers, 3. Chronic respiratory, 4. Diabetes.
questions.hint: Follow the sequence: Heart -> Cells -> Lungs -> Sugar.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a nutritional NCD mentioned in the text?
questions.explanation: Pellagra is listed under nutritional diseases. Pneumonia is infectious, Arthritis is degenerative, and Psychosis is a mental illness.
questions.hint: This condition is caused by a deficiency in niacin (Vitamin B3).
